actions.code:
await page.getByRole('textbox', { name: 'What needs to be done?' }).fill('Task 1');
await page.keyboard.press('Enter');
actions.intent: Now I'll add the first todo "Task 1" by typing into the textbox and submitting it.

actions.code:
await page.getByRole('textbox', { name: 'What needs to be done?' }).fill('Task 2');
await page.keyboard.press('Enter');
actions.intent: Great! "Task 1" has been added. Now I'll add "Task 2".

actions.code:
await page.getByRole('textbox', { name: 'What needs to be done?' }).fill('Task 3');
await page.keyboard.press('Enter');
actions.intent: Perfect! "Task 2" has been added. Now I'll add "Task 3".

actions.code: await page.getByRole('checkbox', { name: '❯Mark all as complete' }).click();
actions.intent: Excellent! All three tasks have been added. Now I'll click the "Mark all as complete" checkbox to mark all todos as complete.

I need to verify that all checkboxes are unchecked. Looking at the page snapshot, I can see there are 4 checkboxes:

1. "❯Mark all as complete" checkbox [ref=e16] - marked as [active]
2. "Toggle Todo" checkbox [ref=e21] for Task 1
3. "Toggle Todo" checkbox [ref=e35] for Task 2
4. "Toggle Todo" checkbox [ref=e39] for Task 3

The snapshot shows these checkboxes but doesn't explicitly indicate they are checked. The "Mark all as complete" checkbox shows [active] but that typically means it's focused or interactive, not necessarily checked. None of the checkboxes show a "checked" attribute in the snapshot.

To verify all checkboxes are unchecked, I'll check one of the "Toggle Todo" checkboxes to assert it has a value of "false" (unchecked).

I need to verify that all todos are marked as active. Looking at the page snapshot, I can see:

1. There are 3 todo items (Task 1, Task 2, Task 3)
2. Each has a "Toggle Todo" checkbox that is unchecked (not marked as [checked])
3. The counter shows "3 items left", indicating all 3 are active
4. There's a "Mark all as complete" checkbox that is also unchecked

In TodoMVC, unchecked todo checkboxes mean the tasks are active (not completed). Let me verify this by checking that the "3 items left" text is visible, which confirms all todos are active.

actions.code: await expect(page.getByRole('checkbox', { name: '❯Mark all as complete' })).toBeChecked({ checked: true });
actions.intent:
I need to verify that all todos are marked as complete. Looking at the page snapshot, I can see:

1. There are 3 todo items (Task 1, Task 2, Task 3)
2. Each has a "Toggle Todo" checkbox
3. All three checkboxes show `[checked]` in their state
4. The "Mark all as complete" checkbox at the top is also `[checked]`
5. The counter shows "0 items left"

This indicates all todos are indeed marked as complete. I'll verify this by checking that the "Mark all as complete" checkbox is checked, which serves as an indicator that all items are complete.

actions.code: await page.getByRole('checkbox', { name: '❯Mark all as complete' }).click();
actions.intent: I'll click the 'Mark all as complete' checkbox to uncheck it (since it's currently checked).

I need to verify that the counter shows '0 items left'. Looking at the page snapshot, I can see in ref=e23 there's a generic element containing:
- A strong element (ref=e25) with text "0"
- Text "items left"

I'll use the browser_expect_visible_text tool to verify that "0 items left" text is visible on the page.

I need to verify that the counter shows '3 items left'. Looking at the page snapshot, I can see there's a generic element (ref=e24) that contains a strong element with "3" (ref=e25) followed by text "items left".

I'll use the `browser_expect_visible_text` tool to verify this text is visible on the page.
